statement: Three players A, B and C play a game with cards bearing distinct integers p < q < r. After at least two rounds of dealing counters, A ends with 20, B with 10, C with 9 counters; in the last round B received r counters. Determine who received q counters on the first round.
In triangle ABC prove that there exists a point D on side AB such that CD is the geometric mean of AD and DB if and only if sin A sin B ≤ sin²(C/2).
Prove that the number Σ_{k=0}^n C(2n+1,2k+1) 2^{3k} is not divisible by 5 for any integer n ≥ 0.

Consider decompositions of an 8×8 chessboard into p non-overlapping rectangles each with equal numbers of white and black squares. Let a_i be the number of white squares in the i-th rectangle and a_1 < a_2 < ⋯ < a_p. Find the maximum possible p and, for this p, all possible sequences (a_1, a_2, ..., a_p).
Determine all possible values of S = a/(a+b+d) + b/(a+b+c) + c/(b+c+d) + d/(a+c+d) where a, b, c, d are arbitrary positive real numbers.
Let P be a non-constant polynomial with integer coefficients. If n(P) denotes the number of distinct integers k such that (P(k))² = 1, prove that n(P) − deg(P) ≤ 2.
